description: Numbers n such that the sum of the primes <= n is a square.
links: G. L. Honaker Jr. and C. Caldwell, Prime Curios!: 9
G. L. Honaker Jr. and C. Caldwell, Prime Curios!: 3531577135439
C. Riveras, PrimePuzzles.Net, Problem 9: Sum of first k primes is perfect square
example: 2+3+5+7+11+13+17+19+23 = 10^2 is a square, so 23 is in the sequence.
mathematica: Prime[#]&/@Flatten[Position[Accumulate[Prime[Range[710000]]],_?(IntegerQ[ Sqrt[#]]&)]] (* This program will generate the first 5 terms of the sequence. *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jun 22 2013 *)
